questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: What is ComfyUI-Crystools?
questions_and_answers.answer: ComfyUI-Crystools is a set of tools for ComfyUI that allows users to see the resources monitor, progress bar & time elapsed, metadata, and compare between two images or two JSONs. It provides better nodes to load/save images, previews, etc., and see 'hidden' data without loading a new workflow.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: What are the features of ComfyUI-Crystools?
questions_and_answers.answer: The features of ComfyUI-Crystools include a resources monitor for real-time stats on CPU, GPU, RAM, VRAM, and space usage; a progress bar on the menu that shows time elapsed at the end of the workflow and the working node when clicked; the ability to view the entire image metadata, even from other sources like Photoshop; the ability to compare two metadata and see differences (with the option of comparing 3 inputs: Prompt, Workflow, and Fileinfo); nodes for debugging like showing the JSON of the prompt and workflow or showing any text or data from the nodes; and more.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: How can I install ComfyUI-Crystools?
questions_and_answers.answer: To install ComfyUI-Crystools, first install ComfyUI, then clone the repo into `custom_nodes`, navigate to the project folder, and run `pip install -r requirements.txt`. Then start ComfyUI.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: What is the ComfyUI-Crystools resources monitor?
questions_and_answers.answer: The ComfyUI-Crystools resources monitor allows users to see real-time stats on CPU, GPU (CUDA only), RAM, VRAM, and space usage. It helps users identify bottlenecks in the workflow and know when it might be time to restart the server, unload models, or close some tabs.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: What is the ComfyUI-Crystools metadata comparator?
questions_and_answers.answer: The ComfyUI-Crystools metadata comparator is a node that allows users to compare two metadata and see the differences. Users can compare three inputs: Prompt, Workflow, and Fileinfo. The main reason for creating this extension was to compare metadata.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: Is ComfyUI-Crystools compatible with Google Colab?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, ComfyUI-Crystools can be used on Google Colab. Users need to install it manually and use the provided link to open a new tab on ComfyUI.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: Can I use ComfyUI-Crystools to show the system stats?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, users can use the 'Stats system' node in ComfyUI-Crystools to show system stats like RAM, VRAM, and Space. The node should be connected as a pipe.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: Can I concatenate values with ComfyUI-Crystools?
questions_and_answers.answer: Yes, with ComfyUI-Crystools, you can concatenate values using the 'List of strings' node. It supports concatenation and provides up to eight possible inputs to use.

questions_and_answers.subject: ComfyUI-Crystools
questions_and_answers.question: What are the primitives nodes in ComfyUI-Crystools?
questions_and_answers.answer: The primitives nodes in ComfyUI-Crystools are a set of nodes with primitive values to use in your prompt. These include nodes for boolean, integer, float, string, and string multiline.
